intro: Cestichis platybulba, commonly known as the broadbulb cestichis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features a robust, bulbous root system that serves as a storage organ for nutrients. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically white or pale yellow, and are arranged in umbels. Cestichis platybulba is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
